1.brief: the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to decay, i.e. (causatively) ruin (literally or figuratively)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)

2.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
properly, to lean out (of a window), i.e. (by implication) peep or gaze (passively, be a spectacle)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
there is or are (or any other form of the verb to be, as may suit the connection)
to be (causatively, make or act) circumspect and hence, intelligent
properly, to tread or frequent; usually to follow (for pursuit or search); by implication, to seek or ask; specifically to worship
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

3.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, to flinch, i.e. (by implication) to go back, literally (to retreat) or figuratively (to apostatize)
to muddle, i.e. (figuratively and intransitive) to turn (morally) corrupt
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
properly, united, i.e. one; or (as an ordinal) first

4.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)

5.brief: there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
to be startled (by a sudden alarm); hence, to fear in general
a (sudden) alarm (properly, the object feared, by implication, the feeling)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a (sudden) alarm (properly, the object feared, by implication, the feeling)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to scatter, whether in enmity or bounty
a bone (as strong); by extension, the body; figuratively, the substance, i.e. (as pron.) selfsame
properly, to incline; by implication, to decline (of the slanting rays of evening); specifically, to pitch atent; gen. to encamp (for abode or siege)
properly, to pale, i.e. by implication to be ashamed; also (by implication) to be disappointed or delayed
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

6.brief: who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
exile, concretely, prisoners; figuratively, a former state of prosperity
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
properly, to spin round (under the influence of any violent emotion), i.e. usually rejoice, or (as cringing) fear
probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
